page.title: 07Education of a Deaf Child
page.content: The parents of Mark thought that the general standard of education for deaf children is very low. Schools still seem to be experimenting to find a generally successful method. Sign language has been out of fashion during the past few years, but now the school are trying a mixture of "sign" language and "vocal". Mark has achieved much more with this method than with the purely "vocal" method. The academic work covered is the same as a normal school and many children go on to take national exams. Mark has a wide vocabulary and will sit and read a newspaper. Socially he won't "talk" to people. The school insist that children go out shopping, Mark doesn't enjoy this. He is insecure about trying new things and he depends very much on adults.
